lines.text:
[narration]
Liquor, I've found, makes me very smart sometimes.

[Seeing the mess in Mike's lap]
What's that?
Ravioli.
Didn't you care for it?
Oh, no. It's very good here.
You're not crying...?
I'm considering it very seriously.
We never argue anymore. And when we do, it never lasts more than a week or two.
So, what's for dinner?

[realizing]
Lori Shannon.
For dinner?

[to Marilla]
How come you cant stand the sight of blood on anyone except me?
They're not reading. They're holding them
[newspapers]
that way in case the blood spatters.
I'm going into the men's room now, to change into the bus boy's green pants.
Maxie, cross-eyed!

[repeated line while punching out everyone within reach]
Cross-eyed? Cross-eyed?
Why is it that you can't stand the sight of blood on anyone but me?
I'll never understand what my husband was doing shoeless in your apartment.
Open your eyes and go to sleep!
